title: Window not found warning on application quit
description:
When quitting a systray application, a warning is logged: 'Window #1 not found'. This happens during cleanup when trying to access windows that have already been destroyed.

Reproduction:
1. Run any systray test (e.g., custom-handlers-gtk4)
2. Use the menu to quit
3. Observe warning in console

Expected: Clean shutdown without warnings
Actual: WRN Window #1 not found

title: Cursor warps to window center on second systray click (Hyprland)
description:
On Hyprland, when using window-menu systray configuration:

1. Click systray icon -> window shows, cursor stays in place
2. Click systray icon again -> window hides then shows, cursor warps to window center

This only happens when toggling via systray icon click. Using menu 'Show Window' doesn't cause the warp.

Likely related to PositionWindow() interaction with Hyprland's focus handling.

Environment: Hyprland, GTK4
Priority: Low (cosmetic issue)

title: Systray API v2: Refactor for cleaner separation of concerns
description:
Redesign systray API for cleaner separation of concerns:

## Core Principles
1. Registration separate from behavior - AttachWindow/SetMenu only register resources
2. Smart defaults with explicit overrides - Works out of the box, customizable when needed
3. Window behavior belongs on window - HideOnFocusLost, HideOnEscape are window options
4. Platform differences handled internally - User expresses intent, implementation adapts

## Smart Defaults
| Configuration | Left-Click | Right-Click |
|--------------|------------|-------------|
| Window only | ToggleWindow | Nothing |
| Menu only | Nothing | ShowMenu |
| Window + Menu | ToggleWindow | ShowMenu |

## Scope
- Window options: HideOnFocusLost, HideOnEscape
- Systray smart defaults
- GTK3 & GTK4 compatibility
- Documentation, tests, examples

title: Add HideOnFocusLost window option
Add HideOnEscape window option
Implement systray smart defaults
Fix Linux systray Activate/SecondaryActivate handlers
description:
Fix Linux systray DBus handlers to call correct click handlers.

Current issues:
- Activate calls doubleClickHandler instead of clickHandler
- ItemIsMenu is always true, causing host to intercept left-click
- Menu property registered even when no menu

Files to modify:
- systemtray_linux.go

Changes:
1. Activate() should call s.parent.clickHandler (not doubleClickHandler)
2. SecondaryActivate() should call s.parent.rightClickHandler
3. ItemIsMenu = false when window attached (let our code handle clicks)
4. Only register Menu property when s.menu != nil

Implementation already partially done in this session - verify and clean up.

title: WebKitGTK 6.0 / GTK4 Support for Wails v3
description:
Add WebKitGTK 6.0 (GTK4) support to Wails v3 as the DEFAULT target. GTK3/WebKit4.1 available via -tags gtk3 for legacy systems.

Architecture:
- Default (no tag): GTK4 + WebKitGTK 6.0
- Legacy (-tags gtk3): GTK3 + WebKit2GTK 4.1

Docker container provides BOTH library sets for cross-compilation:
- task build:linux → GTK4/WebKit6 (modern, default)
- task build:linux:gtk3 → GTK3/WebKit4.1 (legacy backport)

Same pattern as macOS/Windows cross-compilation from Linux.

title: Phase 4: Implement webkit6 asset server
description: webkit6.go, request_linux_webkit6.go, responsewriter_linux_webkit6.go - URI scheme handling with WebKitGTK 6.0 API (webkit_uri_scheme_response_new).

title: Phase 5: Implement GMenu/GAction menu system
description: Complete rewrite from GtkMenu/GtkMenuItem to GMenu/GAction/GtkPopoverMenuBar. Most significant GTK4 change. Reference v2 PR #4570 menu_webkit6.go but fix race conditions.

title: Phase 5: Implement menu item state handling
description: GSimpleAction for text/checkbox/radio items. Stateful actions with g_simple_action_new_stateful. Proper checked state sync. Fix nil checks from v2 PR issues.

title: Phase 5: Implement GTK4 keyboard accelerators
description: gtk_application_set_accels_for_action for menu shortcuts. Map existing accelerator format to GTK4 format.

title: Phase 6: Implement GTK4 clipboard API
description: Replace gtk_clipboard_get with gdk_display_get_clipboard/gdk_display_get_primary_clipboard. Use GdkContentProvider for setting text.

title: Phase 6: Implement GTK4 dialogs
description: File chooser and message dialogs. Use deprecated-but-functional APIs (gtk_file_chooser_dialog_new deprecated 4.10 but works). Consider GtkFileDialog for future.

title: Phase 6: Implement GTK4 screen/monitor handling
description: GdkMonitor/GdkDisplay GTK4 changes. Note: gdk_monitor_is_primary removed - handle gracefully or use alternative detection.

title: Phase 6: Implement GTK4 event controllers
description: Replace GTK3 signals with GTK4 event controllers: GtkGestureClick for button-press, GtkEventControllerKey for key events, GtkEventControllerMotion for motion.

title: Phase 8: V2 PR #4570 Fixes Tracker
description:
Track issues to backport to v2 PR after v3 port complete. Current known issues:
- Race conditions: menu maps accessed without sync (menu_webkit6.go)
- Nil checks missing: gActionIdToMenuItem.Load ignores ok bool (gtk_webkit6.go:18,22,34,45)
- Memory leak: C.CString(title) not freed (window_webkit6.go:384)
- Header mismatch: sendShowInspectorMessage signature wrong (window_webkit6.h:127)
- Wrong cast: GtkWindow passed as GdkToplevel (window_webkit6.c:672,699)
- Broken logic: IsMinimised returns wrong value (window_webkit6.c:383-387)
- Incomplete: drag-drop just prints paths (window_webkit6.c:574-585)
- Missing: separator handling in menus
UPDATE THIS AS MORE ISSUES FOUND DURING V3 PORT

title: Test Strategy: Comprehensive performance benchmark suite
description:
Create benchmark suite to measure GTK4/WebKit6 vs GTK3/WebKit4.1 performance.

RENDERING BENCHMARKS:
- Time to First Paint (TTFP): Measure ms from app start to first meaningful content
- Time to Interactive (TTI): When app responds to user input
- Frame rate during scroll: 60fps target, measure drops
- Large DOM: Render 10,000 list items, measure time and FPS
- DOM manipulation: Add/remove 1000 elements, measure time
- CSS animations: Complex animations, measure frame consistency
- Reflow/repaint: Measure layout thrashing scenarios

BINDING BENCHMARKS:
- Call latency: Round-trip time for Go function call from JS
- Throughput: Calls per second (simple function)
- Large payload: Transfer 1MB JSON Go→JS and JS→Go
- Concurrent calls: 100 simultaneous binding calls
- Callback performance: Go calling back into JS

ASSET SERVER BENCHMARKS:
- Small file latency: Load 1KB file, measure ms
- Large file throughput: Load 10MB file, measure MB/s
- Many files: Load 100 small files sequentially
- Parallel loading: Load 20 files simultaneously
- Streaming: Video/audio streaming performance

MEMORY BENCHMARKS:
- Initial footprint: Memory after app start
- After heavy ops: Memory after DOM/binding stress
- Leak detection: Memory after 1000 window open/close cycles
- Long-running: Memory growth over 1 hour of use

OUTPUT FORMAT:
- JSON results for CI integration
- Markdown report for human review
- Compare GTK4 vs GTK3 side-by-side

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Create v3/test/benchmarks/ directory
- Benchmark app with standardized test pages
- Go benchmark harness using testing.B
- Browser performance APIs (performance.now(), PerformanceObserver)
